heading: the rsi generation
subheading: youngsters could face a future fraught with debilitating injuries as computers become central to their lives. by katie dean.
author: katie dean
text: forget sleazy porn sites and violent computer games. a more dangerous threat to children these days is the computer itself. when the clinton administration pledged to have a computer in every classroom, it did not consider the potential harm that repetitive strain injury could have on students, experts say.see also: rsi: it's not just for geeks
